message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.IR, cs.LG. 

This paper deals with the use of virtual agents in customer service, which involves natural language processing and machine learning techniques (cs.CL, cs.AI). It also focuses on the interaction between users and agents, which falls under the category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The paper uses logs of commercial systems to analyze user-agent interactions, which involves information retrieval and data mining techniques (cs.IR). Finally, the paper discusses the universality of the features used to detect bad conversations, which relates to the field of machine learning and generalization (cs.LG).
